name: inauspiciously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows signs that something will not be successful or positive: She began her career inauspiciously enough as a film company typist. The awards ceremony kicked off inauspiciously when the presenter tripped on his way onto the stage. See
inauspicious
More examplesFewer examplesOur trip started rather inauspiciously when our flight was delayed two hours.The year began inauspiciously for me when I injured my leg skiing.Inauspiciously, the first game of the season ended in a 3-0 defeat.
